intro: Plectranthus deccanicus, commonly known as the Deccan mint, is a perennial herb native to India. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or pink. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and medicinal properties. Plectranthus deccanicus thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable plant for gardens and herbal collections.
